section.title: <xar:set />
section.t: Causes the variable identified by the 'name' attribute to be set to the value of the tag's body. The variable must be available in the scope of the tag. Values set this way do not persist beyond the current page load.

Note: <xar:set> is a bit of a problem child. It is the most vulnerable tag we have, security wise. As the base compilation translates this tag into something like: " echo .....", with some work it's easily abused as a php-scripter tag in our current setup.

t.t: The name of the variable to be set

ed:issue.name: xar:set and xar:var are similar, reflect this in the language
ed:issue.ed:item: This tag either updates or creates variables. The xar:var tags displays them. It feels natural to use the open form of the xar:var tag to create variables where it's children determine its content.

t.artwork:
<xar:set name="$foo">'bar'</xar:set>
Sets the value of variable $foo to 'bar'

ed:issue.name: xar:set definition
ed:issue.ed:item: xar:var and xar:set have strongly related semantics, should we combine/alias the two?
xar:set has the strongest impact on how variable naming and selecting is specified. Especially setting arrays or object properties is now difficult.
